p: Mitigation strategy for SARS-CoV-2 infection is indispensable to allow optimal care for all patients (especially for older people), preservation of all other important hospital services (i.e., surgery, oncology, hematology), and delivery of specific support for affected people directly in the community and public services in this pandemic era. In this respect, it is important to highlight that the significant higher rates of fatal cases in Italy, compared with other countries, might reflect the older population of Italy and underline the need to adapt the mitigation plan to local demographics.
